data.title: River Cruise
data.solution:
import math

t = int(input())
d = int(input())
s = int(input())

print(math.ceil(d / t + (d**2 / t**2 + s**2)**.5))
data.statement:
Your friend Archibald Haddock is about to start a river cruise company. He plans to sell tours lasting [[T]] hours, and wants to buy boats fast enough to travel [[D]] kilometers down the river and back to the starting point. Unfortunately, the river flows at a speed of [[S]] km/h, which complicates the calculations. So he asks you to calculate the minimum speed (rounded up, boat specifications are not so precise) of the boat he should buy. Can you help him?

Example:
On a river flowing at 4 km/h, navigating 6 km and coming back in less than 2 hours requires a speed of 8 km/h: it will let you travel down in half an hour (8 + 4 km/h on 6 km) and travel back in an hour and a half (8 − 4 km/h on 6 km).
data.stubGenerator:
read T:int
read D:int
read S:int

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[T]] for the duration of a tour (hours).
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[D]] for the distance of the point to reach from the starting point (kilometers).
<<Line 3:>> An integer [[S]] for the speed of the river flow (km/h).
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> One integer for the minimum speed needed (km/h).

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your friend Archibald Haddock is about to start a river cruise company. He plans to sell tours lasting T hours, and wants to buy boats fast enough to travel D kilometers down the river and back to the starting point. Unfortunately, the river flows at a speed of S km/h, which complicates the calculations. So he asks you to calculate the minimum speed (rounded up, boat specifications are not so precise) of the boat he should buy. Can you help him?

Example:
On a river flowing at 4 km/h, navigating 6 km and coming back in less than 2 hours requires a speed of 8 km/h: it will let you travel down in half an hour (8 + 4 km/h on 6 km) and travel back in an hour and a half (8 − 4 km/h on 6 km).
Input
Line 1: An integer T for the duration of a tour (hours).
Line 2: An integer D for the distance of the point to reach from the starting point (kilometers).
Line 3: An integer S for the speed of the river flow (km/h).
Output
Line 1: One integer for the minimum speed needed (km/h).
Constraints
0 < T
0 < D
0 ≤ S
Example
Input
2
6
4
Output
8
